name: Qualcomm Global Scholars Program
description: The Qualcomm Global Scholars Program provides scholarships to female students in India who are pursuing undergraduate or postgraduate studies in STEM fields.

name: Microsoft Engage
description: The Microsoft Engage program is a mentorship program that connects students with industry professionals to help them develop their technical and professional skills.

name: Google Women Techmakers Scholarship
description: The Google Women Techmakers Scholarship is designed to encourage women in technology and computing by providing scholarships and opportunities to attend conferences and events.
stipend: $10,000 (for US-based scholars) or local equivalent (for non-US-based scholars)

name: Goldman Sachs Engineering Campus Hiring Program
description: The Goldman Sachs Engineering Campus Hiring Program is aimed at identifying top engineering talent across India and engaging with them through internships and full-time roles.

name: Season of KDE
description: The Season of KDE is a mentorship program that encourages students to contribute to the open-source KDE project and gain experience in software development.

name: Microsoft Research Fellows Program
description: The Microsoft Research Fellows Program provides opportunities for recent PhD graduates to conduct research in collaboration with Microsoft Research in India.

name: Goldman Sachs Women Possibilities Summit: Finance
description: The Goldman Sachs Women Possibilities Summit: Finance is a scholarship program that provides female students with an opportunity to learn about careers in finance and consulting.

name: Internshala Career Scholarship for Girls
description: The Internshala Career Scholarship for Girls is a scholarship program that provides financial assistance to young women pursuing careers in technology and related fields.

name: ETHWMN Fellowship
description: The ETHWMN Fellowship is a fellowship program designed to empower and support women who are interested in pursuing careers in technology and related fields.

name: HPAIR Harvard Conference
org: Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations (HPAIR)

name: Code for Good by JP Morgan
ETHWMN Fellowship
description: The ETHWMN Fellowship is a fellowship program designed to empower and support women who are interested in pursuing careers in technology and related fields.

name: Society of Women Engineers Scholarship Application System
Microsoft Reinforcement Learning Open Source Fest
Virtual Insights Series: An Exploratory Program
Google Summer of Code
description: Google Summer of Code is a global program focused on introducing students to open source software development.

name: Facebook Fellowship Program
stipend: $42,000 USD for tuition and fees, $5,000 USD for travel and conference expenses, and a $2,000 USD stipend for research expenses.
description: The Facebook Fellowship Program is designed to encourage and support promising doctoral students who are engaged in innovative and relevant research in areas related to computer science and engineering.

name: Apple Worldwide Developer Conference (WWDC)
description: The Apple Worldwide Developer Conference (WWDC) is a conference for developers focused on providing them with the latest tools and technologies to create innovative apps for Apple's platforms.

name: Grace Hopper Celebration
description: The Grace Hopper Celebration is the world's largest gathering of women technologists and is designed to bring the community together to discuss and celebrate the contributions of women in technology.

name: The RISE Program at NYU
description: The RISE Program at NYU is a six-week summer program in science and engineering for high school students who have demonstrated an aptitude for and interest in science and technology.

name: NASA Internships
stipend: Varies based on education level and experience
description: NASA Internships provide opportunities for students to gain valuable experience working on projects that contribute to NASA's mission and goals.

name: Code for Good by JPMorgan Chase
description: Code for Good by JPMorgan Chase is a hackathon event that challenges participants to develop innovative solutions that address social and community issues using technology and data.

name: Google Code Jam to I/O for Women
type: Scholarship + VIP tickets to Google I/O

org: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India

type: Ideathon by Linux Foundation and IBM

type: Hackathon with PII and PPO at Infosys
